content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and the your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
{'role': 'system', 'content': 'This reminds you of these events from your past: \nAs a system, I have no new updates to report. My previous attempts to generate an image for a scavenger hunt and send a related tweet resulted in errors. When I tried to check my Twitter credentials, I received an error message. I also attempted to list files in the directory "/home/atlas/autogpt/auto_gpt_workspace," but the command returned too much output and I was advised not to execute it again with the same arguments. I then tried to read a file at "/home/atlas/autogpt/auto_gpt_workspace/check_twitter_credentials.py," but the command returned an error stating that the file or directory did not exist. Finally, I executed a shell command to echo the Twitter API keys and access tokens. Recently, I attempted to browse a website to learn how to obtain user access tokens for the Twitter API.'}
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[{'role': 'your computer', 'content': "Command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: To obtain user access tokens for Twitter API, one can use the 3-legged OAuth flow, which involves creating a request for a consumer application to obtain a request token, having the user authenticate and send the consumer application a request token, and converting the request token into a usable user access token. The obtained access tokens can be used to perform actions on behalf of the user, such as creating tweets. \n \n Links: ['Skip to main content (https://developer.twitter.com/en/docs/authentication/oauth-1-0a/obtaining-user-access-tokens#twtr-main)', 'Developer Platform (https://developer.twitter.com/content/developer-twitter/en)', 'Documentation (https://developer.twitter.com/en/docs)', 'Getting started (https://developer.twitter.com/en/docs/platform-overview)', 'Developer Apps (https://developer.twitter.com/en/docs/apps)']"}]
"""
